page.title: 04HENNY STREET
page.content: THE SITE OF THE FORMER WATERMILL IS OCCUPIED BY A MODERN HOUSE BUT THE MILL HOUSE STILL STANDS.THE MILL POOL IS FISHED BY THE LONDON BANKER WHO COMMUTES FROM HIS HENNY HOME. THE GREENS IN FRONT OF THE SWAN PUB ARE OFTEN OCCUPIED IN GOOD WEATHER BY CUSTOMERS ENJOYING A DRINK OR THE RIVER OR BOTH.THE SWAN WAS USED BY BARGEMEN WHO WORKED THE PAIRS OF BARGES ALOMG THE STOUR NAVIGATION WITH THE AID OF A HORSE, TAKING COAL AND LOCAL BRICKS AND FARM PRODUCE DOWN.THE NAVIGATION WAS CLOSED AT START OF W.W.1.THE WATER MEADOWS ARE SUSTANTIAL AND THE UNDULATING ROAD FROM MIDDLETON THROUGH HENNY TO BURES FOLLOWING THE STOUR MUST BE ONE OF THE MOST ATTRACTIVE DRIVES ANYWHERE -BUT BEST OF ALL USE A BICYCLE.
